revised_title: Carotenoids in the Sexual Reproduction of Aquatic Fungi: A Study on Allomyces
tldr: This study investigates the presence of carotenoids in the sexual phase of the aquatic fungus Allomyces. The researchers found that the male gametangia of Allomyces contain a brilliant orange pigment, which is not present in the female gametangia or asexual plants. The carotenoids play a role in the sexual maturation and fertilization processes of the fungus.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Fungal Biology
